id.description: A unique identifier for the technique.

type.description: The type of object, always 'attack-pattern' for a MITRE ATT&CK technique.

created.description: The date and time the technique was created.

modified.description: The date and time the technique was last modified.

description.description: A brief description of the technique and what it entails.

source_name.description: The name of the external source.

url.description: The URL of the external source.

external_references.description: A list of external references (e.g., URLs or other reference material) that provide more information about the technique.

phase_name.description: The name of the kill chain phase.

phase_order.description: The order of the kill chain phase.

kill_chain_phases.description: The tactics (e.g., Initial Access, Execution, Persistence, etc.) that the technique belongs to, represented as kill chain phases.

x_mitre_version.description: The version of the MITRE ATT&CK framework that the technique belongs to.

x_mitre_deprecated.description: Indicates whether the technique has been deprecated and is no longer in use.

x_mitre_aliases.description: A list of alternate names or aliases for the technique.

x_mitre_permissions_required.description: A list of permissions required for the technique to be executed.

x_mitre_detection.description: A list of methods for detecting the technique.

x_mitre_mitigation.description: A list of methods for mitigating the technique.

x_mitre_data_sources.description: A list of data sources that can be used to detect the technique.

x_mitre_platforms.description: A list of platforms (e.g., Windows, Linux, MacOS, etc.) that the technique can be used on.
